page.title: 15St. Levan Church - Legends
page.content: The bench ends are a distinct feature of the church. One shows{two fish on {one hook.}Selevan caught them like this twice but threw them back. Next time, thinking it a{good omen,}he gave them to his sister from Breage, for her children's tea, but{they choked to {death thus proving it a curse.... On the south side of the church quite near the porch, is a rock known as{St. {Levan's Stone. }It is broken in two, and it was said that Selevan sat upon this rock when he tired from fishing. One day, wishing to leave{a memento of himself in connection with{his}rude but{favourite seat,}he gave it a blow with his hand and cracked it through. He prayed and uttered the prophecy: { When with panniers astride, { A pack horse can ride, { Through Selevan's Stone, { The world will be done....'}
